definitions.definition: A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc.
definitions.example: He was frustrated because he couldn't find anything about dinosaurs in the book.

definitions.definition: A long work fit for publication, typically prose, such as a novel or textbook, and typically published as such a bound collection of sheets, but now sometimes electronically as an e-book.
definitions.example: I have three copies of his first book.

definitions.definition: A major division of a long work.
definitions.example: Genesis is the first book of the Bible.

definitions.definition: A record of betting (from the use of a notebook to record what each person has bet).
definitions.example: I'm running a book on who is going to win the race.

definitions.definition: A convenient collection, in a form resembling a book, of small paper items for individual use.
The script of a musical or opera.
(usually in the plural) Records of the accounts of a business.
A book award, a recognition for receiving the highest grade in a class (traditionally an actual book, but recently more likely a letter or certificate acknowledging the achievement).
(whist) Six tricks taken by one side.
Four of a kind
A document, held by the referee, of the incidents happened in the game.
(by extension) A list of all players who have been booked (received a warning) in a game.
The twenty-sixth Lenormand card.
Any source of instruction.
To reserve (something) for future use.
definitions.example: I can book tickets for the concert next week.

definitions.definition: To write down, to register or record in a book or as in a book.
definitions.example: They booked that message from the hill

definitions.definition: (law enforcement) To record the name and other details of a suspected offender and the offence for later judicial action.
definitions.example: The police booked him for driving too fast.

definitions.definition: To issue with a caution, usually a yellow card, or a red card if a yellow card has already been issued.
To travel very fast.
definitions.example: He was really booking, until he passed the speed trap.

definitions.definition: To record bets as bookmaker.
(law student slang) To receive the highest grade in a class.
definitions.example: The top three students had a bet on which one was going to book their intellectual property class.

definitions.definition: To leave.
definitions.example: He was here earlier, but he booked.
